title: make line wrapping better for inline if statements with comments in function args

labels.name: T: style
labels.description: What do we want Blackened code to look like?

labels.name: F: linebreak
labels.description: How should we split up lines?

body:
I looked through some issues and didn't see any like this. Sorry if this is a duplicate or already discussed. I noticed something I thought was strange and probably the first thing I didn't like about black formatted code ðŸ˜„ 

Something like this:

```python
some_kind_of_data = "foo"
some_other_kind_of_data = "bar"
print(
    dict(
        a=1,
        b=2 if some_kind_of_data is not None else some_other_kind_of_data,  # some explanation of why this is actually necessary
        c=3,
    )
)
```

Using black (python3.7.3, black 19.10b0), becomes:

```python
some_kind_of_data = "foo"
some_other_kind_of_data = "bar"
print(
    dict(
        a=1,
        b=2
        if some_kind_of_data is not None 
        else some_other_kind_of_data,  # some explanation of why this is actually necessary
        c=3,
    )
)
```

**Desired style** How do you think _Black_ should format the above snippets:

Either leave it obnoxiously long, or add parenthesis / indentation

```python
some_kind_of_data = "foo"
some_other_kind_of_data = "bar"
print(
    dict(
        a=1,
        b=(
            2 if some_kind_of_data is not None else some_other_kind_of_data
        ),  # some explanation of why this is actually necessary
        c=3,
    )
)
```
